subject: Re: [junit] Re: Could not connect to: 127.0.0.1:4306
msgSnippet: It looks like there is bug in the jde, I got the fixed junitsupport.jar file from the one of the ibm news group, could remeber which one. any way try coping
messageBody:
It looks like there is bug in the jde, I got the fixed junitsupport.jar file
from the one of the ibm news group, could remeber which one. any way try
coping this to org.eclipse.jdt.junit on plugins directory. This should
resolve the problem.

Good luck!
----- Original Message -----
From: "nils_khare" <nils_khare@yahoo.com>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, February 12, 2002 7:52 PM
Subject: [junit] Re: Could not connect to: 127.0.0.1:4306


> Check if the server is running, socket # is correct and if server
> startup needs to be started from within the code. In the last case
> start it from your setUp() method of Test Class.
>
> - Nils
>
> --- In junit@y..., prasad charasala <charasala@y...> wrote:
> > Hi all,
> > Just started to explore JUnit. Reading the document
> > I am trying to integrate JUnit with IBM Websphere
> > Application Developer (Eclipse). When I run sample
> > test cases I am getting the following error. Please
> > help me.
> >
> > Could not connect to: 127.0.0.1:4306
> > java.net.SocketException: connect (code=10061)
> > at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native
> > Method)
> > at
> > java.net.PlainSocketImpl.doConnect(PlainSocketImpl.java:312)
> > at
> > java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(PlainSocketImpl.java:132)
> > at
> > java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(PlainSocketImpl.java:119)
> > at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:269)
> > at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:98)
> > at
> > org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.connect
> (RemoteTestRunner.java,
> > Compiled Code)
> > at
> > org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:209)
> > at
> > org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main
> (RemoteTestRunner.java:150)
> >
> >
> >
> > It clearly says it is trying to connect to some
> > service at 4306 port, but I don't know what shall I
> > do.
> > Please do reply.
> >
